summary: This is an FBI 302 report summarizing an interview with a witness (referred to as 'Sarah' in the text, though the name is redacted). The witness provides detailed information about her role as an assistant to Jeffrey Epstein, describing the scheduling of massages, the presence of Ghislaine Maxwell, the payment system for girls, Epstein's sexual encounters, and the handling of evidence like message pads and computers. The document reveals operational details of Epstein's activities and the roles of various associates.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case. The witness describes working for him, scheduling his massages (often leading to sexual encounters), his interactions with girls, his possession of cash and guns, and his controlling behavior.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as being present in Epstein's houses, giving instructions to staff, being involved in procuring girls, and participating in threesomes with Epstein. The witness states Maxwell was not a nice person and avoided her.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Mentioned as having been at Epstein's home alone to receive a massage, contradicting a public statement he made about being with his family.

persons.name: Alfred Rodriguez
persons.context: Identified by the witness as possibly being the person whose initials are on a message pad. He had message books in his room when he left.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Identified as one of Epstein's attorneys in New York. The witness recalls being told by Indyke to contact him if she needed help and to never talk to the police.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who traveled to Russia and recruited girls in New York. He shared an apartment with another individual for the purpose of finding girls.

persons.name: Henry Jarecki
persons.context: Described as someone Epstein thought of as a friend. The witness heard he had a girlfriend and saw a picture of him with an unidentified individual.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a message. The witness recalls Epstein had a disagreement with his brother about a hospital bill.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Mentioned as being present in meetings in New York. The witness was trained on how to make calls from her.

persons.name: David Copperfield
persons.context: The witness states she talked with David Copperfield once at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Larry Sommers
persons.context: Recalled visiting Epstein's New York house for a very long meeting. The witness helped serve drinks and food.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Recalled having breakfast with Epstein. A young ballerina dancer curtsied when introduced to him.

persons.name: Diane Von Furstenberg
persons.context: Mentioned as the wife of a man Epstein said was gay and needed to spend more time with two other individuals.

persons.name: Andrew Farkas
persons.context: Introduced a Sultan from Dubai to Epstein. The witness was on the phone with them.

persons.name: Janusz Bashniek
persons.context: Along with another man named Paul, was involved in grabbing computers and notebooks from a location, presumably on Epstein's instruction.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Along with Janusz Bashniek, grabbed computers and notebooks. The witness gave the items to him.

persons.name: Fidel Castro
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a Cuba trip where an unidentified individual kissed his cheek.

persons.name: Jojo
persons.context: Was driving a car in New York with Epstein, the witness, and others inside.

connections.description: Described as former girlfriend and close associate. Maxwell lived in Epstein's houses, gave instructions to his staff, and was involved in procuring girls for him. The witness thought they participated in threesomes.
Indyke is identified as one of Epstein's attorneys. Epstein told the witness to talk to Indyke about an immigration issue, and Indyke later told her to contact him and not talk to police.
Brunel is described as recruiting girls in New York and traveling with Epstein to Russia. They shared an operational connection in procuring individuals.
Dershowitz visited Epstein's home to receive a massage. The witness contradicts Dershowitz's public account of being with family during the visit.
Prince Andrew visited Epstein's home for breakfast. Epstein introduced a young ballerina to him.
The witness worked for Epstein, with Maxwell also giving her tasks and instructions. The witness reported directly to Epstein but also took direction from Maxwell.
Jeffrey Epstein's brother. The witness recalls a disagreement between them about a hospital bill.

events.title: Message Pad Reference to Teenage Girl
events.description: A message pad dated 4/1/05 contained a message that the witness knew referenced a potential teenage girl for Epstein to meet. Ghislaine Maxwell was present and called it a 'funny message' and either made someone rewrite it or rewrote it herself.

events.title: Message Pad Reference to School/Massage
events.description: A message pad dated 2/28/05 referenced 'school'. The witness recalled taking the call and that it was in reference to scheduling a massage.

events.title: Epstein's Tape Recorder Incident
events.description: In the beginning of 2006, the witness saw Epstein reach for a tape recorder and slip it into his bathrobe. She had previously seen the recorder in his duffle bag and turned it off.

events.title: Witness and Accountant Resign
events.description: The witness told Epstein she was resigning, around the same time his accountant resigned. Epstein did not take her seriously initially.

events.title: Seizure of Computers and Notebooks
events.description: Janusz Bashniek and Paul were instructed to grab computers and notebooks. The witness followed up to get the items back to give to a detective. She later gathered books from the island to bring to New York.

events.title: Breakfast with Prince Andrew
events.description: Prince Andrew had breakfast with Epstein. A young ballerina dancer curtsied when Epstein introduced her to Prince Andrew.

events.title: Indyke Instructs Witness Not to Talk to Police
events.description: After a certain point, Darren Indyke told the witness that if she ever needed help to contact him and to never talk to the police.

locations: New York (Epstein's residence and Maxwell's townhouse)
Little St. James Island (Epstein's private island)
Costa Rica (mentioned in context of a volunteer project)
keyFacts: The witness's primary role was to schedule and confirm massage appointments for Jeffrey Epstein, which often led to sexual encounters. Epstein received massages twice a day, every day.

Ghislaine Maxwell was actively involved in the operation, present in the houses, giving instructions, and making comments about messages regarding teenage girls. The witness described her as not nice and someone who reduced staff to tears.
Epstein kept large amounts of cash ($100 bills) in a duffle bag by his desk, from which he would pay girls. Both the girl who brought another girl and the girl who gave the massage were paid.

There was a systematic effort to handle potential evidence: message pads were kept and later taken, computers and notebooks were seized by associates (Janusz Bashniek and Paul), and books were gathered from the island and brought to New York, likely to Maxwell's house.
Epstein possessed a tape recorder that he kept in his duffle bag and bathrobe, and he had guns by his bed. He also conducted background research on the witness's family.
